intro: Pleurothyrium westphaliae, commonly known as the Westphalian pleurothyrium, is a species of flowering plant in the family Meliaceae. It is native to tropical regions of Central and South America, where it typically grows in humid, lowland forests. The plant is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and small, clustered flowers that are often greenish-white in color. Its fruits are capsule-like structures that release tiny seeds when mature. This species is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and ecological adaptations.
